Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_is_my_life_66
Reviews.Content: The Willows is an older hotel on the north end of Lincoln Park, in the city but not downtown. The location is FANTASTIC if you are looking for a real Chicago neighborhood experience. It is one building off Broadway St. which offers everything: restaurants, shops, theater, bars and lively/vibrant/fun people. You can walk to the waterfront (Diversey harbor) about 5 blocks away. You can walk to the "L" and get anywhere (including downtown) in minutes. A bit further walk to Lincoln Park Zoo to the south or Wrigley Field to the north if you are in a walking mood. The hotel is surrounded by apartment and condo buildings down a quiet, short street which is charming, homey and lovely. The residents are friendly and boy oh boy do they love walking their dogs! We met so many people and dogs in this spot-it was nuts! The room/hallways/furnishings are dated but CLEAN. The exec king room is plenty big with a closet, fridge, desk, dresser, iron/board, robes, nice toiletries...everything you need. But trust me, you won't be in your room for long-too much to see and do right outside your door but far enough away to make you feel like you "live" in this charming neighborhood. The employees were very helpful and accommodating. Recommendations: Wilde for dinner, Stella's Diner for breakfast. We will return here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “A Boutique Hotel with Charm”
Reviews.Author: ronniekayd
Reviews.Content: Although the pictures online make it look like a grand historic property, its quite small and quaint. I like small and quaint so this was a plus for me. All was as advertised but our room was incredibly small. It was clean but not luxurious and extremely small. We got a great rate at under $100 a night so I was pleased. Our room was quiet and the location is good as it is within walking distance to lots of great restaurants and shops. Parking is a little challenging but fine.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at the Willows”
Reviews.Author: brendantipperary
Reviews.Content: Excellent inn-like hotel in pleasant area of North Chicago, with easy access to centre of city. There are plenty of restaurants, coffee shops, shops,,cinema, bars etc in the immediate vicinity. The hotel is situated less than 10 minutes walk to Lakeshore Drive and the amazing attractions and facilities of the people friendly lakefront. Continental breakfast and newspapers are available (self-service) in the lobby. We usually loaded the tray and brought it back to our room. Coffee, tea and snacks are provided 24 hours a day. As we were helping out with our newborn grandson who lived with his parents a couple of blocks away, that 24 hour service was a bonus!The rooms are a little dated but clean, comfortable and warm. Maid service was very good. The reception staff, day and night, was excellent. Advice and assistance were given readily and always with a smile. Maybe because it is a comparatively small place compared to the modern high rise city hotels, the staff seemed to know each guest and all were greeted with a cheery 'good morning' or 'good evening'. I must single out the young lady on duty during the day, whose name has slipped my mind. Besides being generally helpful, she surpassed herself on my last day when I was checking out. I had ordered a cab and waited outside for the usuall rapid arrival. She noticed I was still there a few minutes later and sent out another staff member to flag one down on the street. 15 minutes later i saw her racing towards me. She herself had run up to the high street and spent ages trying to hail a cab in a very busy morning rush hour period. No success! However, she suggested she arrange a private limosine service to the airport which would cost $10 extra. 5 minutes later I was on my way- many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “European-style in an all-American city”
Reviews.Author: traveling_grandmothe
Reviews.Content: When staying in Chicago for the birth of a grandchild, we lucked out and found a rock-bottom rate for The Willows. What a find! Located in Lakeview, a very tony and lively neighborhood, The Willows has the kind of service and accommodations we associate with Europe. The executive king room was large and the bathroom was average in size, but both had generous "goodies" of all kinds: robes, bath products, and mini bar supplies and both rooms were spotless. The staff took a personal interest in us and remembered our names. The breakfast buffet is generous, and the parking is very cheap by Chicago standards. We would love to make this our "home away from home" since we are in Chicago often, but the rates in January and February are exceptionally low.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: JanetShu
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in Chicago apt. hunting for my daughter. Hotel was very nice, and the people were so nice. We didn't have luck finding an apt, but the front office hotel manager gave me the name of an apt leasing company, which was great and found my daughter an apt right away. And they also recommended a great restaurant. We did not have a car and could walk everywhere. Price was great, rooms nice, flat screen tvs, breakfast included, great location, Charming. We will go back and stay there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great quaint, historic property”
Reviews.Author: dnaka
Reviews.Content: The hotel offered great rates, comfortable rooms, and a great service attitude by the front desk staff. The heater is radiator, so I had to open the windows to get it my desired temperature. The room was quite spacious. The hot water was also a challenge while showering. But it is a great deal for the money, and a larger room in the city of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place in Lincoln Park”
Reviews.Author: m1021v
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed at the The Willows when we traveled to Chicago to visit Northwestern University. I got a great deal on LivingSocial that included free parking at the hotel. The hotel is right off of Broadway is within short walking distance of nice restaurants and shopping. Lincoln Park is a beautiful upscale area and we felt very safe walking around on a Sunday night. It is a small hotel that has been nicely updated. The beds and pillows were great. They had very nice shower amenities as well as luxurious robes in the room The bathroom did include a hairdryer, which is a good thing since I didn't pack mine. They offer 24-hour coffee in the lobby and a basic continental breakfast. The staff was really nice! The only problem I encountered was that I couldn't get the water hot enough in the the shower.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice, inexpensive hotel 3 miles North of the Loop”
Reviews.Author: PaBell55
Reviews.Content: This is not for you readers who want your typical three- or four-star modern hotel experience. On the other hand, if you like a bargain price [we paid $60/night for 2 in a "deluxe queen" with fully satisfactory continental breakfast], you like being in a very pleasant, small business/residential neighborhood quite near Lake Michigan and Lincoln Park (but 3 + miles from the Loop), and you don't mind a place that is and feels old (yet clean), this is a quite good choice. We walked down a main street to the Loop, enjoying the shops, restaurants, people and architecture along the way. It is easy to get a bus to and from the heart of the Loop. Several reasonably priced Zagat- or Michelin-rated restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quiet location”
Reviews.Author: upnorthjodie
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel during a recent vacation weekend in Chicago. We were looking for a quiet, quaint, historic place to stay in Lincoln Park and the Willows Hotel fit the bill perfectly. The staff was especially helpful. They allowed us to use their computer, printed maps for our expeditions and gave theater recommendations. Rooms were clean and decent sized for a big city hotel. Beds were wonderful with high quality linens. I slept like a dream. Room temperature was perfect at all times. We never had to fiddle with the thermostat once. Showers were hot with strong water pressure. One slight criticism, I wish the rooms had a chain lock. I sometimes worry that one deadbolt is not secure enough in a big city. This hotel seems to attract quiet patrons. There was no excessive noise or rowdiness. The continental breakfast was simple but decent. I had a toasted bagel with cream cheese every morning. They had a nice selection of bagel flavors and they appeared to be purchased from a local bakery rather than Lenders type bagels. The breakfast did not include any hot food, other than what could be toasted or microwaved. It included hard-boiled eggs, fruit cups, yogurt cups, small amount of fresh fruit, good coffee, cereal and other pastries. The public transportation system (Brown line on El) was about 3-4 blocks away. It was an easy and safe walk and we used public transportation extensively. From the Brown line, one can connect with other lines and go almost anywhere in the city. I would strongly recommend purchasing a CTA pass for your Chicago stay. We got WAY more than our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GREAT PLACE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: risker4638
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this property since it's previous days of being called "The Surf Hotel!" The location is perfect. Nestled on a quite corner of a busy area that is easily walkable! The staff are AWESOME! I've stayed there during the heat of Chicago's summer as well as in mid winder when it was snowing like crazy! LOVED IT each time! Very warm and inviting environment and I just can't recommend the hotel high enough. Honestly, I've actually opted to stay here (at my own expense) on several occasions when others in my party were staying at more lavish propertys in town. Needless to say, I'm a fan!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Merdan
Reviews.Content: Pros: Lovely old building with lots of character on a quiet street, breakfast included, helpful, accommodating staff, reasonable price. Cons: The room furnishings are tired and dated. We were there in early November and apparently the steam heat was not on yet. We complained we were cold and were told the heat would kick on. It never did. We found out at check out that some rooms have an additional wall heater, ours did not. Finally they brought us a space heater which is less than ideal to sleep with. We complained at check out and they comp'd our parking. We chose the hotel because it is close to the family we were visiting. Unfortunately, the choices in this neighborhood are limited.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, quaint building, excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: Doug R
Reviews.Content: Pros: Staff could not be friendlier, lovely quaint building, great (continental) breakfast included, location is perfect for Lincoln Park and Diversey, Bally's Fitness included. If you get lucky and find a spot, you can park on the street for free during your stay. Cons: The room we stayed in was very comfortable but quite cramped. Some noise heard from room next door as that bathroom abutted our sleeping area. This may be specific to the room we stayed in, but I suspect it's just a function of an older builiding.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff.....”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Willows is the very friendly and accomodating staff....from the front desk to housekeeping. Our room was clean and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. We had the "basic" queen room which is quite small so it's not a room to have if you plan on spending a lot of time in your room. Next time I would opt for a larger (though more expensive) room if available. The complimentary breakfast was better than average but there are no sit-down tables in the lobby so they have large trays to balance on your lap. I appreciated the complimentary newspapers and free (and good) 24 hour coffee/tea service. Nice neighborhood to walk around and several nice bars/restaurants within easy walking distance. Robert

Reviews.Title: “Will come back again”
Reviews.Author: borderline
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely and charming hotel in Chicago. It's not downtown but it's on a lovely neighborhood. The buses around the corner will take you to downtown (about 20 minutes ride) The staff were very helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Free breakfast and free internet. Overall great hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Old world meets modern convenience”
Reviews.Author: JHawkGirl29
Reviews.Content: The Willows is apart of the 'neighborhood inns of chicago' chain, but there's nothing chain-like about this hotel. From the moment I checked into the hotel to checkout, I was impressed with the service I received, and the quality of my room. Although the room itself was a bit more small than I originally expected, I liked the set up and it was perfect for one person. The hotel has an afternoon tea/coffee and cookies daily, which was nice to come to after a long day of business-related work. As for the location, it was ok; there were a few restuarants and bars in the neighborhood, but parking was challenging. As a young woman, I did not care for the in & out parking's location-it was in a poorly lit alley on the side of the hotel, with lots of dumpsters and hiding places for muggers. Other than the parking, I loved the hotel, and would stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Janet W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited family in Chicago. This hotel was very nice and the price was great!! The staff went above and beyond to make us feel at home. They were so friendly!! The room was comfortable and very clean... The coffee and tea in the lobby was a very nice touch. The continental breakfast was great. I will definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: maureen13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 day visit to Chicago and our stay at the Willows made the entire experience perfect. Located just 15 minutes from downtown by bus, this lovely neighbourhood hotel made for a great escape from the noise and bustle of the city. It is situated in a great neighbourhood within minutes of fabulous restaurants, shopping and Lincoln Park. On site parking is only $22.00 per day. The helpful staff are another plus for this hotel. Everyone was friendly and offered suggestions for restaurants and directions when needed. John was a particular favourite who answered every question with a broad smile. Enjoy your stay at this gem of a hotel. Ron & Maureen

Reviews.Title: “Why isn't this one on the top of the TA list?”
Reviews.Author: Suporto
Reviews.Content: Chose this quiet hotel for its proximity to the Italian consulate downtown (3 miles). Walked in late at night to a lovely French provincial (with fireplace) lobby and the friendliest host. Traveling singly I had expected a small, nothing room but mine was charming with a soft bed, large wardrobe and desk that had a chair that didn't kill my back (free wifi). The bathroom was actually larger than ones I have had in double rooms. Opened the honor bar for a bourbon and coke for $5--just what I needed after traveling all day. I needed a cab the next morning and the host actually ran down a half block to hail a cab from the corner (3 times)! Next time I want to explore the neighborhood--a few streets away a myriad of little shops and restaurants. Charming.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Week”
Reviews.Author: Leslie H
Reviews.Content: We spent a week visiting the city, and could not have picked a more perfect place to stay. Elegant and comfortable, this hotel has it all. Our room - a king suite - had a spacious sitting room as you enter the door and was beautifully appointed. The continental breakfast has something to offer everyone, and the hotel is located in a great neighborhood. The staff was wonderful - special thanks to John B. and Caren for their help. I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoanneandDick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary in Chicago and could not have found a better place to stay while there! The staff is excellent - very friendly and helpful with directions, info, restaurant recommendations and more - even running down to the corner to hail a cab for us! The room was cozy, clean and comfy - very European and old-style, which we prefer! I loved the daily fitness club pass; we both loved the character of the building and the neighborhood. I could just repeat what the other reviews say about the breakfast, etc. but for us, the general ambiance and the wonderful staff are the best reasons to make The Willows our Chicago home away from home!!

Reviews.Title: “Willows made first stay in Chicago wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Kgdavid65
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at The Willows for 3 days and had a wonderful experience. The friendly front desk staff was very accommodating and helped us find our way around a new city. The room was very nice, bed was comfortable, mini bar was priced reasonably and the people couldn't have been nicer. We will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: cincinnatis
Reviews.Content: Decided to visit the Windy City for a 3-night end-of-summer treat with our college bound sons. Found The Willows on line and it was just as lovely as the pictures had shown. Rooms are very affordable (had to rent two) and the location was quite picturesque... quaint Chicago neighborhood, very quiet and away from downtown hysteria! Still had plenty of stores and eateries just around the corner. Breakfast included with stay, afternoon sweets, and best of all a daily complimentary pass to Bally's Fitness (just around the corner). Wine available in your room for only $15 a bottle and snacks for just a buck. This place is a terrific find. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “WHY STAY ANYWHERE ELSE?”
Reviews.Author: theghostwriter
Reviews.Content: The answer, quite simply, is if you're going to Chicago for business (as I recently did) or pleasure (and I had plenty of time for that as well) the lovely Willows fits the bill. The entire staff couldn't have been more professional or friendly (or helpful) and the hotel itself and the rooms couldn't have been more comfortable or better appointed. You can keep your commercial "chain" hotels (unless it's the chain called Broughton which owns this and 2 other hotels in Chicago; and,I believe in California) and give me the European-style quality and comforts of The Willows. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “European feel in a wonderful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: USAtraveler077
Reviews.Content: The hotel is somewhat dated, but makes up for it in good customer service. The manager was very attentive to our needs and was quick to address any of our concerns. The kings size bed we had was very comfortable. The hotel was very clean and the continental breakfast exceeded our expectations. The room had a window air conditioner versus cetral air, but it did cool the room and there was a good ceiling fan. The neighborhood is quiet and upscale, but there are stores, restuarants and an "art" type movie theatre all within a couple blocks walk. The theatre has at least 6 different screens and shows "film festival" type films. Taxis to Rush street, Second City or Union Stration (train) cost under $20. Although we are frequent visitors to Chicago, this hotel allowed us to experience the town more as a "local" versus a "tourist".

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MettaMomma
Reviews.Content: I stayed there several days this month while attending an improv workshop at Second City. The hotel was very clean and attractive, staff was friendly and helpful. The in room honor bar was reasonably priced -- $4 for small bottles of spirits, $1 for small packages of cookies. Nice continental breakfast every morning featuring boiled eggs, cereals, bagels, juice, coffee, tee and danish pastries. The hotel is well located in a lovely, safe neighborhood that's a couple of easy blocks away from public transportation. I'd definitely stay there again. While I could have taken public transportation to Second City, I chose to walk, and it took just 40 pleasant minutes

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: harks
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. As expected it is an older building; but was decorated nicely and seemed to be upgraded. Our king size room was quite large, but we did walk past a few rooms which were much smaller. The desk staff were so friendly and knowledgeable. We arrived early and they held our luggage. Anytime we were waiting in the lobby for our niece they would chat with us. Very pleasant. Breakfasts were simple, but they got the day started. My only sightseeing goal this trip was an architectural tour by water. Loved it and highly recommend it. We did take the one run by the architectural association. We tried to get to the aquarium on one of those hot days and couldn't get near it. So we went to the Field Museum instead; it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tennesseemn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a trip to see some Cubs games. What a great Hotel!! The room was very clean. The Beds where super comfy, and the Staff was great. My only complaint is the Elevator is so small, but thats it. The Hotel is close to Wrigley if you dont mind a short walk. There are several places to eat around the Hotel also. I highly recommend this hotel. !!! Great Place.

Reviews.Title: “NY Yankees vs. Cubs weekend - Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: suzyb61
Reviews.Content: We arrived early Friday morning at The Willows for a NY Yankees vs. Cubs weekend. Check-in was not until 3pm, but the amazing staff at the front desk informed us that our room was ready early. We reserved a small queen room which was very nice, but was quite small. The room included an elegant wood armour complete with luxury robes. Also included was wireless Internet access, TVs with expanded cable channels, full bath amenities, makeup mirror and a hairdryer. We were scheduled to stay for 3 nights, but found the room to be much too small. At our request, the front desk was able to move us to a king junior suite which was amazing! The suite had 2 wing chairs in the front room complete with flat screen TV & minibar. The bedroom had a king bed, wood armour (including those wonderful bathrobes), flat screen tv, minibar, a desk & chair. We spent the rest of the weekend enjoying the great neighborhood, it's food, the city of Chicago and it's great baseball fans! In the lobby, complimentary continental breakfast was served in the morning and a social with cookies in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Exploring Lakeview & Downtown”
Reviews.Author: ChiRedFlyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Willows over Mother's Day weekend. The stay simply wonderful. Located just off Broadway where it meets Clark St., this tiny gem is just steps away from boutique shopping and a ton of dining choices. If you want something a little more fancy, cabs are easy to catch nearby or if you're on a budget, walk over to Walgreens to buy a CTA day pass for $5. You can catch the #36 Broadway or #22 Clark(about a block away) to take you to Lincoln Park Zoo, the Mag Mile, the Loop or go North to Wrigleyville for a game. Very nice staff. Front desk bent over backwards to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. PROS: Location, staff, suite room size, mini bar prices and snacks, free breakfast selection, room size, 2 nice televisions, price was resonable, shopping and dining choices nearby. CONS: Overnight parking not available at hotel. We found overnight on Broadway but you have to feed the meter(kind of a pain) There is parking over on Clark at the Landmark/Bally's Total Fitness but it's pricey. No restaurant on site. Coffee shop or sandwich shop would be nice. Room next to stairwell was LOUD. Could not hear it in other room, so just ask for something away from stairs. OVERALL: We had a really nice stay and plan to stay again. Just nice to be able to shop a little and run the stuff back to your room. Then we hopped on a bus (just cross the street for pick up) and went down to the Nature Museum or Lincoln Park Zoo. Definately spend the extra $50 for the 2 room suite, makes it feel like you're at home.

Reviews.Title: “Very good customer service”
Reviews.Author: Il0veItaly
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago. We stayed here 2 nights. I chose this hotel because my daughter is going to school in September and looking for a apartment around this area. Location was perfect ! Many cute shops and restaurants, almost like 'Village" in NYC. People at the hotel was very nice and helpful. I was worrying about parking, but it was located right next to the hotel and rate was $22 a day. Hotel will provide a "key" to open the parking garage gate, in and out anytime you want. Only bad experience was air conditioner .. almost all the buildings in Chicago are very old. Hotel has "Window" air conditioner. Around 3 AM people above us came back from late night drinking. They were so loud, walking and talking then, turned a air on... nightmare began... the water dripping from their air conditioner to ours made "LOUD" banging noise. I'm not exaggerating ... it sounded like someone is hitting metal with a hammer. I was up from 3 AM on. It was impossible to go back to sleep. I told the front desk next morning and they changed our room to top floor. Breakfast was served in the lobby, bagel (It was really good ! I'm very surprised to have good bagel outside NYC) , muffins, pastry and boiled egg with coffee, tea and orange juice. It was nice to start your day. Overall, hotel is very pleasant with very nice staff !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GreatTrip5353
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in a double queen. Lots of space, great bathroom. Good location with lots of restaurants and shopping. Decent breakfast. The staff was friendly and the place was very clean. Overall it was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Jellona
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights in a standard room in May 2011 and we definetly expected something better. The room was cramped and dark with dirty feeling because of thick carpeted floor (we also spotted one cockroach). Just behind the window was a narrow alley with some traffic and people going by, so you really didn't want to open the curtains. Outside the door in the corridor (just opposite our room) was a noisy ice cube machine. You got used to the noise though, but every time somebody got some ice (like the staff for the breakfast) you realised how close it really was... And the complimentary breakfast was a joke, at least from European point of view. Just some unhealthy cereals and wheat bagels... Coffee was good, though. Well, something good, too. The (mostly white) neighbourhood is quite nice with plenty of restaurants, shops and other services. A metro station is also within walking distance, and the beach by Lake Michigan as well...

Reviews.Title: “Great Lincoln Park Value”
Reviews.Author: azkfmn
Reviews.Content: Clean, well maintained and safe. in very trendy GLU type urban neighborhood at Clark and Diversy. older building with horizontal rooms? flat screen TVS. Extra for parking garage around the corner, with unlimited in/out privileges. second stay...first on business a few years ago! This time with wife and kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice European style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marvfish
Reviews.Content: A little hard to find but worth the effort. A nice spacious comfortable room, not elegant but more than adequate. Although we did not use the mini-bar, I was pleased to see that the snack and drink prices were very reasonable by hotel standards. One small drawback, the parking, although reasonably priced for a Chicago hotel, was inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kirkwall1
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were efficient, friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and quiet (great beds) Good bus service is appx five minutes walk from the hotel. We did not find many good restaurants nearby. Our time was limited so we had a good lunch downtown and snacked in a cafe in the evening.The hotel breakfast was varied and plentiful. I cannot think of anything to dislike about The Willows Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Historic and quaint, helpful staff, tiny bathroom w/no vanity,”
Reviews.Author: funtravel4466
Reviews.Content: Were in town for Oprah's last show and stayed one night. Chose this hotel because it came up as being in close proximity to the studio (3 miles). It's actually 6 miles away. Was difficult getting taxi, although front desk said one would be by quickly, we had to walk down to nearest busier street to hail one. Historic hotel that has been updated. So decor is fine but uneven floors, very small elevator, and tiny bathroom are to be expected I guess. Bathroom had pedestal sink and no counter space at all for two women to get ready, so that was difficult. Bed and desk area were so close together that you couldn't get through if someone was sitting at the desk - I had to roll over the bed to get to the bathroom. Undesirable view out the windows (room #408). Staff was friendly and helpful and breakfast bar was more than adequate. Choc. chip cookies in afternoon were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for couples”
Reviews.Author: usually_happy64
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Willows because the reviews were good, it was in an area we wanted to be in and the price was great (through Booking.com). The hotel is in the Lincoln Park/Lakewood area and is near many restaurants and shopping in addition to Lincoln Park Zoo and the beach. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite. The bedroom was a decent size with a king bed (I especially liked the linensâ€¦very white and double sheeted) a nightstand and lamp on each side of the bed, a flat screen TV, a desk, a very small bureau and a closet. The sitting room had a fully stocked refrigerator (at reasonable prices), another TV, two comfortable chairs with a table and lamp between them. The bathroom was past the sitting room. It was very small and poorly laid out. In order to stand at the sink you really needed to close the door, which made it seem even more claustrophobic. Still, the bathroom had a tub/shower combo with good water pressure. What really makes this hotel special was the staff. Each employee seemed dedicated to making me happy. They were always helpful and there were enough of them so I never needed to wait long for attention. Cookies are served everyday from 4-6 and they are good!. We were on the third floor (there are 4 floors total) and the room was quiet. The continental breakfast exceeded my expectations. Along with coffee, tea, decaf, orange juice, they offered bagels, pastries, muffins, yoghurts, fruit cups, apples, dry cereal, assorted flavors of hot oatmeal, and Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches. Nothing was home made, but everything was fresh. The hotel offers free entry into a nearby gym. Parking is either $17/day or $22/in-out privileges. We were lucky; we stayed for three nights and only had to purchase parking one night, the other two days we were able to find street parking. Still, even if you pay, it is far less than downtown Chicago prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great little neighborhood hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Onree
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Willows Thursday-Saturday while visiting our daughter who lives in the neighborhood. Older small Euro style hotel. Cozy little lobby with a fireplace and front desk with a friendly and helpful staff that knows the hospitality business as well as the neighborhood. Very reasonably priced. We paid $595.19 for three nights, including parking, all taxes, and several things from the well stocked and VERY reasonably priced mini-fridge and snack tray. Clean, comfortable, and very well kept, even if a little frayed around the edges. Will definitely stay there again. We loved the neighborhood, but don't believe the "couple blocks walk to the lake," it's much farther than that. But there are numerous eating and drinking establishments within a block or two on Broadway, Clark, and Diversey, as well as small shops, theaters, etc. I'd sure like to find a place just like this in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay in Chicago in Adorable, Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyNicki37
Reviews.Content: I don't have anything negative to say about my stay. My partner and I stayed for one night in their super tiny budget room and it was so cute. It was small, but we don't need much (I did peek in to the other rooms on way to check out and they were much bigger). Such a cute and quaint hotel with a very nice staff. We liked the location too. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Chingis09
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Willows for two nights. The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. The location is great - close to shops and restaurants in the Lincoln Park section of Chicago. Our room had a nice shower and the bathroom mirror which accommodated three females dealing with hair and make-up in the morning - nice bonus. The radiator in the room seemed antiquated but we turned it off and did not require using it during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, Great value”
Reviews.Author: oy-bell
Reviews.Content: Got a very good deal and was upgraded to a room with a bigger bed. Location perfect for our requirements and close to large range of restaurants, bars, shops etc. Find that down town becomes quite dead after workers leave and Lakeview comes more alive. Hotel was clean and comfortable with wi-fi and complimentary breakfast which is more than adequate to start the day. Could do with some redecorating but for the price, location, atmosphere, staff, rating - couldn't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Exoerience”
Reviews.Author: janetboblove
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at The Willows! Thier pillows are delightful. Clean and very confortable. Pretty too!

Reviews.Title: “Vintage,comfortable, and no bedbugs!!”
Reviews.Author: roserage
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just last week for one night as my brother was having surgery at a near by hosp. Staff were very nice ,made sure I got in safe as I had a late night return from the hosp and had to be buzzed in. My room was small, but suited my purpose. Even though the hotel had no record of bedbugs I did my own check and the sheets and bed were immaculate! I slept very comfortably all night. The continental breakfast was great- just need some portable trays on tables to eat on. Would stay here again . I have stayed at the Gramercy Park Hotel in New York in1980 and the Willows was cleaner,much quieter and better maintained- like being back in an "old charming days" hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean and friendly hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: maryjane333
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a king exec room. It was large, clean and comfortable. The staff were especially helpful in helping me with finding places to eat/visit, and the continental breakfast was very good. The surrounding area was also very nice, with many independent shops and restaurants. The free wifi worked well, and when I needed documents printed, the staff were helpful. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in a Neighborhood Setting”
Reviews.Author: kjj319
Reviews.Content: Staff extremely friendly and helpful from the time of check-in to check-out. Rooms, though small, were very clean and serviced promptly everyday of our stay. Excellent continental breakfast in lovely appointed lobby. Will definitely stay there again for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Lakeview”
Reviews.Author: AdventureGal1973
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to take a trip to Chicago for our anniversary. I used to live in Chicago, so, I was looking to get out of the tourist trap areas and show her the fun and interesting things to see in the north side neighborhoods. The Hotel was quite lovely, rooms small but comfortable. The beds were comfortable, morning breakfast was decent, service was excellent. The location was great. Right near Broadway and Diversey. Just a couple blocks to the 151 bus to get downtown and a 10 minute walk to the great shops, bars and restaurants in Boystown. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend the Willows to anyone who wanted an off the beaten path stay in a comfortable, clean, delightful little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: jeffp94114
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 days in August, in an "Executive Room" which was very big and nicely appointed. Quiet area, very comfy bed & good linens made for a good sleep every night. The neighborhood is residential with a good local street full of local shops and restaurants, nothing too fancy but that's how we like it anyways. It's a 10+ block walk to the closest transit line though (Diversey), which gets a bit tired after a couple of days of sightseeing; also if you're walking to the gay neighborhood along North Halstead, again it's 10-15 minutes each way. The only drawback is the hotel doesn't have central A/C, so in the hot season you have to have window air conditioners (2 in our big room) roaring away. Early August was 85 and muggy every day. In all though, it was a very nice stay and the staff were very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SusanLois
Reviews.Content: We stay here often and are picky travelers. The hotel is located in a scenic historic neighborhood - lovely area for walking. The rooms, though considered small, are very comfortable with good beds and nice quality linens. The bathrooms are nice too. The hotel is old and well-maintained with a mature and friendly staff. The parking is in an open garage behind the hotel and is perfect as most Chicago hotels offer parking blocks away. The breakfast is nothing special, but is nicely display. The coffee is good, the o.j. tastes fake as does the apple juice. The Willows is the best choice in the Lincoln Pk/Lakeview area.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Bart85
Reviews.Content: A real gem. NIce homey feeling with some great touches like the sculpted rugs. If you like a small hotel, in a residential neighborhood of upscale four story apartment buildings this is the place. Only a couple of blocks walk to the lake. Room was plenty big, nice desk space and good size bath with nice amentities like sculpted carpeting. Freindly staff Very queit atmosphere throughout hotel. Friendly staff. Nice change from the big flag box hotels and quick short hop to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Gregan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in a deluxe double room and got a fantastic deal through booking.com - it was only $120 per night inc. tax. The room was nice and spacious and had nice plush carpet. It also had a nice comfortable bed and fluffy pillows and a large LCD TV. The drinks in the fridge were well priced and they had a "snack" menu for room service that also seemed very well priced, eg. $3 for pizza! On the down side, we did find that there was a car park right near our room (we were on the third floor), which caused a bit of noise, especially when the automatic gate was used. The rate also included breakfast in the lobby. It wasn't anything fancy or elaborate, but it was still good and there were a few different options - cereal, bagels, apples, muffins, yoghurt and coffee. The hotel is conveniently located in a nice area and is about 10 minutes walking distance from the Diversey El station. The hotel is also very close to Lincoln Park and the Lincoln Park Zoo - we caught a bus there which only took about 5 minutes and the bus stop was very close to the hotel. There are also many shops and restaurants nearby. The staff at the front desk were nice, with the exception of one man who was quite rude, but fortunately we only had to deal with him once. Overall, this was a great hotel and excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, very satisfying visit.”
Reviews.Author: Infrequent_Flyer53
Reviews.Content: I'm grateful to my daughter's roommate's parents for recommending the Willows when I came to visit her in Lincoln Park. Interesting (if not totally handicapped-accessible*) 1920s structure, smallish, recently renovated, part of a 3-property hotel group that seems to focus on value and amenities. Lobby area, where continental breakfast is served until 10 a.m., is cozy and well-furnished. My (two queen bed) room was spacious, beds and linens comfy, bathroom small but updated. Staff is attentive, the facility is clean and well-kept. A quasi-boutique hotel at Days Inn prices--what's not to like? (*Lobby is a few steps down from street level, and I saw no ramp or other means to get a wheelchair down to that level. The hotel may have an alternate way to get handicapped guests to the lobby; I didn't inquire, but wanted to pass along this information about the main entrance.)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: 2TravelMore2
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at the Willows while visiting friends who live in the neighborhood. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was very clean and the beds and pillows were GREAT. I am extremely picky about hotel beds so this is saying something. The rooms are small but just fine for two people. There was a mini bar with snacks and drinks, which were reasonably priced items such as $1 diet coke or $2 water. Don't expect a view as its only a 5 story brownstone type building. The location was great in the quiet and safe neighborhood of Lakeview and only 4 blocks from the Lake. There was a nice complementry continential breakfast in the morning with bagels, cereal, hard boiled eggs, toast, pastries, fruit, yogurt, etc. Can't beat the price of $80 on a Sunday for a good Chicago location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Bargain, outstanding location!”
Reviews.Author: Jabswitch
Reviews.Content: Older boutique. Quiet, well kept. Nice continental breakfast and helpful front desk. Tons of small eating places. Try Efe's Turksish restaurant a few buildings down.

Reviews.Title: “Off-site Parking At Your Own Risk"”
Reviews.Author: JeannieSue
Reviews.Content: The Willows website boasts about having parking with "unlimited in and out privileges." Well, you should know that the Willows Hotel has "No Parking" on-site. The so-called hotel parking is actually an unmanned public parking garage down the ALLEY from the hotel. When I complained that the website was misleading the clerk said, "None of the hotels in Lincoln Park here have their own parking." If you think it's risky walking from the parking garage to the hotel at night, just wait until you get your credit card bill. Immediately after we used a credit card at the garage's unmanned kiosk, some enterprising credit card thieves (in the NY area) began a frenzied & fraudulent spending spree. Within four days of our stay at the Willows -- and it's off-site public parking garage -- over $10K in fraudulent charges were posted to the credit card used to pay for the parking. I never would have stayed at the Willows if had I known about the lousy parking situation. But, I had no idea that staying at the Willows with its off-site parking would be such a costly mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: corley52
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear because we wanted to go to the Kingston Mines and a few other Blues bars in that area. Very nice area to walk around and feal safe late at night. Lincoln park Zoo is about a mile walking distance from the hotel and there is plenty of places to eat. The front desk when we arrived was very helpful and pleasant. He gave us great advice about the places we were inquiring about ( eating,music,sightseeing). The room was pretty good as we had the King Junior suite, Bathrooms are very small, not much room around the sink to place anything. Beds Are very very comfortable. Walls are very thin, you can hear everything, as we were next to the staircase and could hear everyone going up and down the stairs. If you stay hear I would not recommend staying on the West side of the Hotel, there are trucks loading in the Alley beside you at 7A.M and they are there for most of the morning, but there is an alley on the East side to but it is a through lane so it might not be so bad. Internet was free and worked very well. Continental breakfast was excellent and free, parking was behind the building and looked pretty safe. Staff could not have been any nicer. No hairdryer or microwave, TVs work great. Elevator is small and hallways have a funny smell. But overall I would stay here again and would recommend it as long as you know this is what this hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel in a good area”
Reviews.Author: Moreita
Reviews.Content: Rooms were large and the beds were very comfortable with soft duvets and plenty of pillows. We slept very well! Flat-screen TV mounted on the wall. Old-fashioned decor, very classy and everything in working order. We were on the third floor and had no problems at all with the elevator. The neighborhood is absolutely lovely and residential and made me want to live there! However, you should be aware that downtown Chicago is a bit of a distance. Four minor complaints: 1- as other reviewers have noted, the front desk staff leaves somthing to be desired. They're not outright nasty or anything, just indifferent and not up to the niceness of the hotel itself. 2- It's far from the "L," about a half-mile walk. Not a big deal in nice weather, but if you're coming home late and you're tired, the last thing you need is a long walk. Bus is closer. 3- Not nearly enough seating at breakfast. There are no tables to eat at; you just kind of grab your stuff and balance it on your lap or on cocktail tables and there is just never enough space. 4-While the bedroom was quiet, when I was in the bathroom I could hear the entire conversation of my neighbors, and I don't think they were yelling, either. Personally, I found the price to be high, but maybe that's just Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy. Poorly Staffed”
Reviews.Author: WKP3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Willows on a recent trip to Chicago and was slightly underwhelmed in comparison to other travelers who have reviewed it here. My room, a first floor "suite", was apparently located under the stairwell that leads from the lobby to the second floor. This was not a problem during the day. But, was quite noisy at 3 am on Friday and Saturday night when drunken revelers came stomping home from the local bars. More so when the staff began digging ice from the ice machine next to my room at 6 am for the continental breakfast that the hotel serves in its lobby. In the case of the Willows, the excessive noise could be contained by the simple installation of some acoustic tiles and/or insulation under the offending staircase and more considerate behavior by the staff. The suite consisted of one large room with a wall installed in the middle of it and a couple of chairs, a tv and wet bar in the sitting area. It certainly was not worth the extra expense. The bedroom had a rather old window unit air conditioner which was unnecessary the night I was there. Heat, which would have been welcome the night of my visit, appears to be radiated steam heat as one might find in many older Chicago buildings. The bathroom was tiny and one could nat maneuver around its door without having to close it. The bedding was quite comfortble. However, the room fixtures including carpet were old, worn and appeared to be in need of replacement The neighborhood is quite nice. Many dining and drinking options are available within blocks of the hotel. It is quite close to the Lake Michigan beaches if one is traveling in summer. The hotel does offer a gym membership at a local Bally's. The staff seems a bit inept. Not capable of dealing with difficulties encountered by other guests checking in at the same time I was. There are only a scant few hotels in this neighborhood which is surprising given its proximity to Wrigley Field. My experience at all has been quite underwhelming (including at the Willow's sister hotel, the City Suites on Belmont, which backs up to an active El track). I suspect that the demand caused by the lack of competition in the neighborhood creates an environment where the hotel operators don't have to excel to keep guests coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, reasonably priced, and in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: KcSuds
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three-night stay at The Willows Hotel and found it to be very pleasant. It's clean, the staff is thoughtful, and the Lakeview East neighborhood is a joy and easy base for a stay in Chicago. We had an executive king room and my only complaint about our room is its loud air conditioner. It kept me awake for much of the first night. We later ran it only during the daytime when we were gone. When we returned, we turned off the air conditioner and turned on the big overhead fan. That worked well but the weather was cooler than normal during our stay in Chicago. I don't know if that method would work in a heat wave. Nonetheless, we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All around great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fhv_58
Reviews.Content: I just got home from my one night stay at The Willows hotel. I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel was for how low the price. The hotel has a very nice atmosphere. The front desk can be a bit slow at times, but that is my only complaint. The room was very nice and clean. Located in a very nice neighborhood. About a 20 minute walk from Wrigley Field. The hotel is right by restaurants, shops, bars, etc... I will definitely consider staying here again for my next visit to chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Due to overbooking at another Hotel we were stranded until the staff of the Willow (especially Bill) came to our rescue.”
Reviews.Author: charlitta
Reviews.Content: Great staff that were there when you needed them. What a GREAT experience it was staying near the heart of Boystown. The food, the people and the atmosphere near Halstead was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely spot in Lincoln Park”
Reviews.Author: bereakentucky
Reviews.Content: I am a Days Inn patron, but the DI was down with an electrical virus and the lovely reservations manager there suggested the Willows for my stay. I had a lovely room with the back view, but it was quiet, neat, and perfectly suited to my tastes - operable windows, best neighborhood in Chicago, easy access to all of my usual haunts. The free breakfast was a great perk, and I had a small fridge, another necessity. Lack of a safe was my only quibble. If you are looking for a truly calm experience in a real neighborhood with a boutique, not over-the-top atmosphere, the Willows is a great choice. The access to Bally Fitness, also offered by Days Inn, is a wonderful added attraction.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: badger36
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a great part of Chicago - very quiet street and a short walk from some great bars and restaurants and it is only a 5/10 minute drive to downdown Chicago. The restuarants are also much better value in this neighbourhood than downtown. The staff were wonderul and always willing to help. The rooms of very high standard and extremely comfortable. They do a very simple buffet breakfast - nothing special but was included in the price. You can take your breakfast up to your room - which is quite helpful as the space and seating in reception is not really geared up for eating breakfast. They also have tea and coffee on tap 24/7. This is a great hotel and really is home from home. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: YOW76
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago to hang out with friends and I selected The Willows because: 1) It is in my old neighbourhood (Lakeview), which I love and 2) it is convenient to get to Boystown, Wrigleyville, the Near North, The Loop, and Evanston: all locations I wanted to visit on this trip. I loved the architecture of the hotel and my room was quite large. The free breakfast is continental, but it is ample. The service was efficient, but not overly warm. I have stayed here once before and will definitely stay again. Some general recommendations: 1) Book on Expedia or another travel website. This is my second time at The Willows and both times the rates on their website were more expensive than on Expedia. 2) From O'Hare, take the Blue Line to Logan Square and then bus #76 to Sheridan. Get off at Diversey and Clark. It is only one block away from the hotel. 3) Explore the local neighbourhood on foot. There are wonderful shops, especially walking north on Broadway. Be sure to try Intelligentsia Coffee on Broadway. 4) If you are going to the Magnificent Mile, walk to Diversey and Sheridan (only a couple of blocks from the hotel), and take the 151 Sheridan bus south. It will drop you off right on Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet place”
Reviews.Author: Traveler79Illinois
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and comfortable hotel. OUr room smelled like fresh laundry!! Beds were comfy and linens were luxurious. Lobby is very relaxing and well kept. Breakfast was more than satisfactory, hotel personnel were very friendly. It is in Lakeview / Lincoln Park area away from hustle and bustle of downtown. - I loved the location and there are plenty of places to shop and eat right in the neighborhood. I will stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikagarwal
Reviews.Content: This is a nice cozy hotel in lincoln park suburbs of chicago. It has a old european style looks and style. the washroom was small and the bath tub drain was not opening so water was holding up in the tub. You can hear people walking up/down the stairs, as my room was just next to the staircase.

Reviews.Title: “A Chicago favorite, suffering a bit from poor staffing”
Reviews.Author: plazascribe
Reviews.Content: This is one of the hidden gems of Chicago, especially if you want to feel like you're living in a Chicago neighborhood. Boutique by nature, with rooms that are nicely kept, large and comfortable (albeit somewhat aged) and easy access to restaurants and shopping. Here's the problem, though: the staff is ambivalent and, sometimes, outright rude. This is really disturbing to me, as I love the hotel itself. I stayed for several days on the most recent visit, and nearly every staff member was outright dismissive. Frequently, there's no one at the desk (which made me wonder if this is really something the management should know about), and when there is someone, it's a guarantee that he won't greet you and won't ever smile. Bottom line is that this is an above average property downgraded by a personnel problem.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: yamhill
Reviews.Content: I was having a difficult time with my 4 star bidding (my bids were getting too too high in the Loop and River North) on Priceline because I would be staying midweek rather than the weekend but..it all turned out just fine when I got a Wednesday and Thursday night on the 3 star Willows at a good price. No compaints. The Willows is an older, refurbished hotel nestled in the safe Lakeview East neighborhood and it served me well. Reminded me of a small european hotel. I had a first floor room so I didn't get in on the elevator adventures I had read about in other reviews. The room and bath were clean. Comfortable bed. The staff was friendly and attentive. Nice breakfast. What I liked most about The Willows was its great location. Close to good restaurants and shopping. A mall with a Borders is a block away and a 5 minute walk takes you to the 151 bus that'll get you downtown. I also liked the convenience of taking the blue line from O'Hare transfering to the 76 bus at Logan Square and arriving within a block of The Willows. This public transportation airport to hotel jaunt took a little over an hour. No need for a car. Chicago has excellent public transportation. I got a visitors pass. Highly recommended. If you like to walk or jog you are very close to the Lake Michigan waterfront trails and the north end of Lincoln Park. While not the fanciest of places to stay The Willows still has plenty of charm that would be lacking if you stayed at chain hotels in the vicinity. I couldn't say adios to the place without having my picture taken by the nice desk clerk with me standing in front of that neat french fireplace in thelobby. Only regret would be not getting a ride on the legendary Rube Goldberg lift. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jabezgreen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two night son busines inChicago. While my meetings were downtown, and the Willows is in Lincoln Park area, I stayed because theprice was about $200 less per night. The Hotel is on Surf Street in a quiet residential neighborhood, but is very close to shops and restaurants. Also, it is very easy to take the bus downtown and bck uptown at days end. A two dollar bus ride is far better than a twenty dollar cab ride. Over all the hotel is neat and clean and staff very friendly. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “The Willows saved my trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: miker75058
Reviews.Content: I flew to Chicago for a Cubs game on August 18 and experienced a horrible flight- three hour delay, a missed connection, almost missed my rescheduled connection, and lost luggage. By the time we arrived at The Willows I was absolutely frustrated. The front desk changed all that. He was friendly, got us checked in quickly, gave us a demonstation of the old-fashioned elevator, and wrote down our luggage information for when it arrived. After freshening up (with the care package that the airline gave us) he gave us competent directions to the train and gave us all the information we needed as to which stops to get off (Sears Tower, Billy Goat Tavern ect.). The decor of this hotel is nice. It is old-fashioned (I'm not positive what decade it is, I think the 20's) and they have swing/ jazz music playing in the lobby. The location is on a quiet little side street in a nice neighborhood. Wrigley Field is about a 20 minute walk and there are plenty of restauraunts and bars/pubs in the area. You can get everything you need within walking distance (groceries, drug stores, ect.). Everyone at the front desk that I encountered at The Willows seemed to go out of his way to accomadate us. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Born_yesterday
Reviews.Content: This hotel has several good points and a few not so great. On the good side, the staff is friendly and very willing to help out. When I first arrived I was given a room that had a window facing the main street. The next day I asked if I could be moved to a different room so that I could sleep better without traffic noise and they granted my request without a problem. The room furniture is generally in good shape and the bathrooms are clean. A continental breakfast is included. There's free wireless internet all over the hotel. My room had air conditioning but not all rooms do. The hotel is close to numerous restaurants and pubs in a good area of Chicago. The one criticism I have is that hotel is showing its wear and tear. For example, the carpets in the entire premises need replacement. Perhaps this is not a big deal for some people, but given that I paid $150 per night (incl. tax), I would have expected a better upkeep of the hotel or else a lower nightly rate.

Reviews.Title: “quaint, small, overpriced, but great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: bobbi222
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great neighborhood, near the lake and many great restaurants. My husband and I have stayed in some laughably small rooms here, when nothing else was available (but the price was smaller too). The staff have always been very friendly and helpful. There is an expanded contintental breakfast, which is adequate. And tea and fresh-baked cookies everyday at 4pm. I love walking out the front door of the hotel right into a lovely Chicago neighborhood. And there are so many restaurants and stores on Clark and Broadway. It is a lovely walk to the lakefront. The rooms really are small, and the place is overpriced, but I always enjoy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Location”
Reviews.Author: Newman1
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Willows. The staff was very helpful. Needed to stay past regular checkout time and the staff was very accommodating They even let us stay in the parking garage at no extra cost. The continental breakfast has a nice variety of cereals, bagels, breakfast sandwichs and juice. The location is in a nice residential area and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Willows is the best!”
Reviews.Author: notime00
Reviews.Content: The Willows hotel is my favorite place to stay when visiting Chicago. It is located in a great neighborhood near the lakefront with a huge selection of Restaurants and shops in walking distance. The hotel is quiet and the rooms are very clean. I find the staff to always be exceptionally kind and helpful which really makes this hotel feel like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden GEM”
Reviews.Author: marino44
Reviews.Content: I have been to Chicago many times for business and usually stay with Hilton or Marriot, but one trip they were sold out and came along the Willows and had a fantastic stay. The Hotel was just renovated from top to bottom and the staff is always great. Great restaurants within walking distance and bars. They also have two other properties Majestic and City Suites which look just as great. Take my word on this hotel you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LuvstheOBX
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the The Willows three times this year, and each time has been a positive experience. And, we were there in three seasons (Feb. the weekend of the big snowstorm that closed the airports, Labor Day weekend, and end of October), so we can vouch for the excellent heat, air conditioning, and good 'ol fresh air from an opened window. The hotel is old, but who cares. My criteria is clean, safe, a comfortable bed, decent bathroom (which includes hot water for showering), and air conditioning in the summer. When the room description says small, they are being honest. We joke that we have to go outside to change our minds, but we are traveling for reasons other than sitting in a hotel room, so the Willows accommodates our needs perfectly. I love sitting in the lobby with a cup of tea in the mornings, reading the paper and watching the guests that are in and out. A very interesting cross-section of the world come through their doors; and everyone including guests smile and speak to you. We've walked throughout the neighborhood, including Wrigley Field (and yes, the Cubs won), to Filipo's (a great Italian restaurant) which is at the other end of Lincoln Park, and felt perfectly safe. We also were dealing with a car. Fortunately, for an extra $20 a day, the hotel provides a parking pass to a garage located right behind the hotel. Well-worth it, since parking space is soooo limited in Lincoln Park. The only downside is the elevator - it's quaint, however, when you are using the elevator with luggage, it is VERY difficult to hold two doors open, load your luggage, then yourself. We use the stairs except upon arrival and departure with luggage. I would also recommend calling the hotel directly when making reservations. Each time I made reservations, I started with the online website (Hotels.com), and there was no room availabilitly for the dates I was going to be there, and the quoted rate was about $50.00 higher. I then called the hotel directly, and they did have rooms available and discounted the rooms each time. This is not the only hotel I have encountered the issue of room availability when using online services; I may be old fashioned, but I prefer the direct contact.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice for lodging but a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wjamg
Reviews.Content: I was in the Chicago area for a convention and wanted to stay downtown to be near McCormick Place. However, the only available room I could find was at the Willows in Lakeview. I really enjoyed the neighborhood! I love walking to the small shops, it was nice after a hectic day downtown. I rode the CTA to save on transportation and it was easy to do. The hotel room was very small but the bed was comfortable. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower1342
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Willows for our honeymoon. We loved the property and the neighborhood. It was within walking distance to Wrigley and downtown was short taxi ride away. We are planning an anual trip to Chicago and will stay at the Willows again. The breakfast was good and the afternoon cookies and lemonade added the extra touch to the stay. Staff was awesome and very friendly. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Bathroom floors were heated.

Reviews.Title: “great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: m0mt0f0ur
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Willows several times due to our daughter seeing a specialist at Children's hospital. Sure the hotel is old, but it is very clean and comfortable. The staff was excellent every time we have stayed there, very helpful and friendly. The coffee and tea available 24 hours is nice as are the bathrobes in the rooms. The best pizza my family has ever eaten was in a small pizza parlor around the corner. On the down side, the sink in the bathroom is too small to lay things for getting ready. The parking garage is a bit of walk, but is secure and private. We love the Willows and stay there every time we're in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, neighborhood hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonWhite
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel when visiting our son who recently moved to the Lincoln Park area. The Willows was perfect for us, as there are few hotels close to his apartment. The Willows reminds one of hotels in the UK and was a break from the run of the mill chain hotel. Warm, comfortable lobby with fireplace and coffee. Continental breakfast in the morning and great cookies at 4 pm. Excellent value for a Chicago hotel. We will definitely stay here again when we visit our son.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Willows”
Reviews.Author: laughli7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Willows a couple nights after our wedding in Chicago. After being at the Palmer House Hilton (which is lovely) we were looking forward to getting out of downtown. The Willows is in a great neighborhood and so peaceful and quiet. The hotel is charming and we loved the lemonade and cookies. Everything was clean and the room very comfortable. If it's a nice day and you're up for a walk, Wrigley is (a bit of a hike) but definitely doable. We would stay there again. It's location is great - not downtown, but close enough to be accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Marcia432
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Willows Hotel several times because of it's great location. It's located in a lovely neighbourhood in the Lakeview area of Chicago and is in walking distance of Wrigley Field and lots of interesting restaurants on Clark Street. Our experience there has been hit and miss. Front desk staff can be friendly and knowledgeble, or clueless. I love the small elevator with the brass folding gate. It makes me feel like I'm in Europe. Rooms are generally small, but comfortable. The lobby has classical music playing and excellent coffee, and average breakfast snacks. On this stay our room had NO temperature controls, and we were dying in the heat. The front desk did offer to change our room, but this was after we were in bed and moved in, and we didn't take them up on it. But beware of the rooms in the front of the building: rooms 200, 201, 300, 301, etc. None of them have temperature control. Will we stay there again? Probably. We're CUBS fans. Location, location, location...

Reviews.Title: “Victorian Stay”
Reviews.Author: traveler983
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Willows for the first time in April 2006. This hotel is very clean and comfortable, but keep in mid it is not a new hotel. It is Victorian, quaint and quiet. Our room was one queen/king bed - non smoking room. One side of the bed was against the wall, which made it difficult for two to sleep in, if you have to get up during the night to use the bath room. If you are cuddlers in bed - then this bed will work for you. We thought the mattress needed to be replaced as it sunk slightly in the middle. The size of the room was rather small to medium - we had adequate storage space for clothes, a desk with lamp and a chair, a luggage rack, a tv, adequate drawers, a bedside table with lamp and a ceiling fan with a light. The room also had a new air conditioner in the window. The bathroom was very victorian & clean, newly decorated and a nice size - it even had a vented window by the tub to open while you showered, which I considered a plus since there were no fans or other vents in the bathroom. Music is played in the lobby during their extended complimentary breakfast hours, which we found to be a plus. The location of this hotel is wonderful. It is one block from everything you want from restaurants to book stores and other shopping. The area is a hub of hussle bussel, but the hotel is quiet and restful. The staff is very nice and helpful too. Parking was a short distance away, about a half block - you park the car yourself.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the Chicago Marathon and found this great little hotel on the internet.I'm from a small town and not use to a big city but found the Willows to be charming and very safe. The staff was so friendly and the room very clean. I saw someone who wrote the there floor was dirty but mine looked like new carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my wedding night. Although the room was clean and nicely laid out, I would never stay there again and regret staying there. There's a metal cage (radiator?) on the wall right over the toilet, which was a pleasure ramming my shoulder into in the middle of the night by accident. The doors in the hallway slam so you will not get a good night's rest. The check-out staff apparantly couldn't be bothered to ask how our stay was. I recall a mumbled goodbye. The Pits.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Chicago had to go there for a medical appt for my daughter. The staff at this hotel were so helpful. Even printed out directions for getting around town. Very comfy rooms, suprisingly very quiet also. The hotel was almost like an oasis from the hustle and bustle of the city. The tree lined street the hotel is located on was lovely! Very conveniently located. If I ever return to Chicago no matter what my budget is for the trip this hotel will have my business. They were great. Coffee and tea vailable 24/7 in the lobby. And the coffee was great. Cant say enough how much we enjoyed our stay here. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: drl80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights - very friendly staff, nice location, presentable accommodation. Would stay here again if looking to be in the Lincoln Park area although would probably stay downtown next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locale, very accomodating, a nice stay indeed”
Reviews.Author: shay&thecity
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic little hotel if you want to be in the Lincoln Pk area - nothing too fancy, but just fine - clean & quaint. The staff is very helpful - on a nice residential street - the charm of a European inn.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My brother and I came to visit Chicago for a family wedding. The bride and groom had made reservations for a lot of the family to stay at the Willows Hotel, and while I generally stay downtown for business, I was surprised by how nice the Willows was! There were quite a few really nice little shops/restaurants/bars in the area; not to mention the fact that we walked to the lake, the zoo, and the conservatory. It was a cute and quiet little place with very helpful and friendly staff, I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay in Lincoln Park - I guess The Willows will do”
Reviews.Author: slfWestHartford
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Willows for 5 nights this Dec. 04 b/c it was a few blocks from our daughter's apt. Be forwearned - their internet ad is MUCH nicer than the reality. It's centrally located if you want to stay in Lincoln Park - but it isn't a cute, boutique hotel, even though it advertises itself as one. The lobby was a bit shabby - and the free continental breakfast was fast-foodish, carb-laden, and recycled. We didn't eat it once. The hallways were long and narrow - not very inviting. I felt as if I were walking down an old-fashioned rooming house kind of place - not an inviting little hotel. The elevator was a small, old cage affair (cute in movies, not in real life). Our room was very 1950's - beige, dingy, and dark. We had twin beds, I think - not two queens. Our windows overlooked a parking lot which had an all-night light that shined and made loud noises (so I wore ear plugs and kept the shades down). The bathroom was large - clean - and the products were replenished daily. We could hear someone practicing her flute down the hall - and people having sex in a room above us. The people next door had small kids - which we could hear clearly through the walls. Our TV was small - but hooked up to cable. There wasn't a closet - just an old armoire. I checked out the Days Inn a few blocks away - and The Willows was definitely better - but it wasn't a great, charming, adorable place by any stretch of the imagination.

Reviews.Title: “stay at the willows”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at The Willows while we were downtown for work. We thought the hotel was very nice, and the staff was helpful to us in finding a restaurant that had been recommended to us. We are from a small town, and really appreciated the relaxed, friendly atmosphere in the middle of the big city.

Reviews.Title: “...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with the Willows hotel when I arrived there for a two night stay last weekend. The lobby was cute & the room was nice & clean. There were a few minor issues that popped up though that altered my original impression. I managed to score one of the previously mentioned 01 rooms with a view of tree-lined W Surf St. Although small, the room was bright & had a fresh, clean smell. When I walked back to the hotel from the parking lot, I noticed many air conditioners in the windows of the rooms, however my room didn't seem to have one. Fortunately it didn't get very warm & it wasn't an issue, but I wouldn't want to stay in that room on a hot, sticky day. The bathroom was clean, cute & a little small. The main issue I had with the bathroom though, was the water pressure. Showering became very difficult as the water quickly went from hot, to cold, back to hot, slowed to a trickle, back to cold, etc... In spite of these inconveniences, I would recommend this hotel to others. It is in a great location & the staff is very friendly & helpful. Just be prepared, this isn't a luxury hotel so don't expect perfection.

Reviews.Title: “a charming alternative to the Loop hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We travel to Chicago 15-20 times per year for weekends and stay at many of the hotels in town. We find ourselves often returning to the Willows as a pleasant alternative to the downtown scene. Perhaps the greatest asset of this hotel is the neighborhood: it's nice to be in a residential area filled with lively service businesses...you have access to some real Chicago living here away from the bustle (and cost) of downtown . The hotel itself is perfectly serviceable and well maintained, with a charming little lobby area, and relatively generic non-descript rooms. We prefer the rooms in the front of the hotel (the 00 and 01 rooms) which are smaller, but cozier somehow. The staff here has always been friendly and helpful, and there are 2 convenient parking garages nearby. This an easy place to stay, but you won't be fussed over. A terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay at the Willows”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, barebones staff and poor security make this hotel undesirable. I stayed there for an extended weekend and had a CD player stolen from my belongings. The manager was very rude and antagonistic about the situation. I would never stay there again.
